newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain Treasury sees cheaper yields in EMU - Ferrer.
newsitem.headline: Spain Treasury sees cheaper yields in EMU - Ferrer.

text.p: Spain has started to reissue six-month bills in order to later take advantage of potentially cheaper long-term borrowing costs once it has joined monetary union, the Treasury's Federico Ferrer told RFTV in Tokyo.

"We are very much aware of the fact that entering monetary union in just 2-1/2 years the less 10-year and five-year paper, the better. The more short-to-maturity, the better," said Ferrer, deputy director for foreign financing.
"We believe our yields will be substantially lower as soon as we start issuing in Europe," he said.
The Treasury started to reissue six-month paper last month, after a hiatus since August 30, 1995.
But Ferrer said Spain will continue supplying sufficient liquidity to other market segments.
"Rest assured that we will continue issuing 10-, 5-, 3-, 15-year paper as well as much as is needed to maintain the highest level of liquidity in the market," he said.
